Parts of the body

1.Here are some body parts. Can you match them with their definition?

  1. The natural covering of your body

  2. The hard white parts inside your body that form your skeleton

  3. The thin tubes in your body that carry blood to the heart

  4. A part of your body where two bones meet, like your elbow, or your knee, and that you can bend

  5. The bony part of your head that is around your brain

  6. A long thin fiber which sends messages between your brain and other parts of the body

  7. The large organ inside your head that you think with

  8. The long line of bones down your back

  9. The red liquid inside your body that you can see if you cut yourself

2. Here are some more words related to medicine. Match them with the picture.

3. Complete these sentences with words from exercises 1 and 2.

  1. Because I broke my leg I had to walk on c.

  2. James cut his hand badly on some glass, so he had to have 10 s.

  3. As people get older, they have more and more difficulty in moving their j.

4. Here are some words and their definitions. Use the words to complete the sentences below.

blister (n and v)a painful swelling on the surface of the skin, often caused by the skin rubbing against a hard surface.
bruise (n and v)a purple mark on the body, caused by something hitting hard against the body.
burn (n and v)a red mark on the skin caused by something very hot, like a fire.
sprain (n and v)the injury caused by accidentally twisting a part of the body, like a wrist, ankle or hip.
fracture (n and v)a light crack or break in a bone.
sting (n and v)a sharp pain on your skin, caused by an insect, like a bee.
itch (n and v)an unpleasant feeling on a part of the skin which makes you want to scratch.
bite (n and v)a mark on your body caused by an animal or insect biting you.
cut (n and v)an open line on your body caused by a sharp instrument, and which bleeds.

  2. The on my knee needed ten stitches
  3. Because of the fall she was covered with
  4. Watch out for the bee; it might you!
  5. The in her hip bone was caused by the fall.
  6. The dog resulted in a nasty infection
  7. Wool sweaters always make my skin
  8. This on my hand was caused by ironing in a hurry.
  9. A fall while playing tennis can result in a ankle.
